titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bruce Cratsley Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:11

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of photographic prints by and topical files of Bruce Cratsley. Also included is White Light, Silent Shadows , a book of Cratsley's photography.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Bruce Cratsley Archive and William Leight, 2004, Jane Cratsley, 2006, and John Cratsley, 2008.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the Estate of Bruce Cratsley for materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator. On January 1, 2041, copyright passes to Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bruce Cratsley Papers (MS 1836). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The photographs are arranged by size and chronologically therein.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bruce Cratsley was born in Canton, Pennsylvania, and graduated from Swarthmore College. His interest in photography led him to study under Lisette Model at the New School for Social Research in the early 1970s. His work was displayed in prominent New York galleries and ranged from portraits of friends, to still lifes and photographs of gay and lesbian culture in New York City. A retrospective of his work was mounted at the Brooklyn Museum of Art in 1996 to critical acclaim. White Light, Silent Shadows , containing a selection of his photographs, was published in 1998. Bruce Cratsley died on June 29, 1998, of complications from AIDS.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist photographic prints by and topical files of Bruce Cratsley. Also included is White Light, Silent Shadows , a book of Cratsley's photography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All titles and dates are from a list provided by the donors. The photographs are arranged by size. Within size, they are arranged chronologically, and within year, alphabetically by title. Where titles and dates found on the backs of photographs vary from those on the donor list, the variants are listed in quotation marks in square brackets. For photographs published in White Light, Silent Shadows (Santa Fe: Arena Editions, 1998), published title and page number are indicated in square brackets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of black and white photographic prints and topical files. The topical files contain correspondence, announcements, reviews and other publicity, and a resume documenting Cratsley's professional life, particularly his shows and other projects.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: All titles and dates are from a list provided by the donors. The accession is arranged in two sections: photographs and topical files. The photographs are arranged by size. Within size, they are arranged chronologically, and within year, alphabetically by title. Where titles and dates found on the backs of photographs vary from those on the donor list, the variants are listed in quotation marks in square brackets. For photographs published in White Light, Silent Shadows (Santa Fe: Arena Editions 1998), published title and page number are indicated in square brackets. The topical files are arranged alphabetically.
